column2: From your prompt I understand that you want me to undertake the Scope 3 Portfolio Analysis (carbon foot printing) of the proposed investment uploaded in the spreadsheet.

I will read the Excel file you have uploaded and then dynamically create the required workflow to perform this task. At a high level the work I will perform will follow the workflow outlined below at the high level.
The full workflow breakdown can be inspected in the Directed Acyclic Graph (DAG) tab
As a comparison, I will contract my Scope 3 calculations for the new 18 investments against L&G's existing portfolio and external benchmarks
Existing L&G Portfolio will be taken from L&G 2024 Sustainability Report unless otherwise stated
Total estimated CO2 equivalent for the 18 investments is 180 tCO2E (compared to 4,900,000 tCO2e (2024 L&G Sustainability Report).

Conclusion: 18 additional investments are on whole more sustainable ('greener') than L&G's existing portfolio across all key metrics (Carbon Intensity (tCO2e/£m), Weighted Average Carbon Intensity (WACI),Portfolio Temperature Alignment ©)

Conclusion: 18 additional investments are less carbon intensive across all three asset classes than the existing L&G portfolio. Carbon intensity for proposed investment in real estate equity is still above the external benchmark.
Carbon Intensity (tCO2e/£m) - Investments Under Consideration Compared to Existing Portfolio

Conclusion: 18 additional investments are less carbon intensive than the existing portfolio apart from the proposed invetment in the utilities sector which are more carbon intensive.  investments in this secrot
